question.text: Question 1: What is meant by inter-systems communication?

options.option: Communication between different programming languages
Communication between different computer systems
Communication between different network protocols
Communication between different operating systems

question.text: Question 2: What is the purpose of inter-systems communication?

options.option: To enable data exchange and coordination between systems
To enhance user interfaces in integrated applications
To optimize code execution in integrated systems
To secure network communication in integration projects

question.answer: To enable data exchange and coordination between systems

question.text: Question 3: What is meant by synchronous communication?

options.option: Communication where both sender and receiver are online at the same time
Communication where data is transmitted in real-time
Communication where data is transmitted in a continuous stream
Communication where sender and receiver are geographically close

question.answer: Communication where both sender and receiver are online at the same time

question.text: Question 4: What is meant by asynchronous communication?

options.option: Communication where data is transmitted in real-time
Communication where data is transmitted in a continuous stream
Communication where both sender and receiver are online at the same time
Communication where sender and receiver are geographically close

question.answer: Communication where data is transmitted in a continuous stream

question.text: Question 5: What is meant by request/response communication?

options.option: Communication where one system requests data from another system and receives a response
Communication where data is continuously transmitted between systems
Communication where systems exchange data simultaneously
Communication where systems send and receive data in real-time

question.answer: Communication where one system requests data from another system and receives a response

question.text: Question 6: What is meant by publish/subscribe communication?

options.option: Communication where systems exchange data simultaneously
Communication where one system publishes messages and other systems subscribe to receive them
Communication where one system continuously transmits data to another system
Communication where systems send and receive data in real-time

question.answer: Communication where one system publishes messages and other systems subscribe to receive them

question.text: Question 7: What is meant by point-to-point communication?

options.option: Communication where systems exchange data simultaneously
Communication where one system publishes messages and other systems subscribe to receive them
Communication where one system transmits data to a specific recipient
Communication where systems send and receive data in real-time

question.answer: Communication where one system transmits data to a specific recipient

question.text: Question 8: What is meant by message-oriented communication?

options.option: Communication where systems exchange data simultaneously
Communication where one system transmits data to a specific recipient
Communication where one system publishes messages and other systems subscribe to receive them
Communication where systems send and receive data in real-time

question.answer: Communication where one system publishes messages and other systems subscribe to receive them

question.text: Question 9: What is meant by event-driven communication?

options.option: Communication where one system continuously transmits data to another system
Communication where systems send and receive data in real-time
Communication where systems exchange data simultaneously
Communication where systems communicate based on triggered events or signals

question.answer: Communication where systems communicate based on triggered events or signals

question.text: Question 10: What is meant by streaming communication?

options.option: Communication where one system continuously transmits data to another system
Communication where systems send and receive data in real-time
Communication where systems exchange data simultaneously
Communication where systems communicate based on triggered events or signals

question.answer: Communication where one system continuously transmits data to another system
